intro: Dianthus barbatus var. ramosus, commonly known as the clustered carnation, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its dense clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are borne in compact inflorescences, giving it a full, bushy appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for gardens and floral arrangements due to its vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms.
